DeepMatter.Autoencoders.Conv2d package¶

Submodules¶

DeepMatter.Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae module¶

class Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.Sampling(trainable=True, name=None, dtype=None, dynamic=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: tensorflow.python.keras.engine.base_layer.Layer

Uses (z_mean, z_log_var) to sample z, the vector encoding a digit.

call(inputs)[source]¶

This is where the layer’s logic lives.

Note here that call() method in tf.keras is little bit different from keras API. In keras API, you can pass support masking for layers as additional arguments. Whereas tf.keras has compute_mask() method to support masking.

Arguments:

inputs: Input tensor, or list/tuple of input tensors. **kwargs: Additional keyword arguments. Currently unused.

Returns:

A tensor or list/tuple of tensors.

Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.Train(epochs, initial_epoch, epoch_per_increase, initial_beta, beta_per_increase, new_data, folder_, ith_epoch=None, file_path=None, batch_size=300)[source]¶
Parameters

  • epochs (int) – total epochs training

  • epoch_per_increase (int) – number of epochs of each beta increase

  • initial_beta (float) – initial beta value

  • beta_per_increase (float) – beta increase for each epoch_per_increase

  • new_data (array) – input data set

  • folder (string) – folder save the weights

  • ith_epoch (int) – training from the ith epoch

  • file_path (string) – weights dictionary from ith epoch

  • batch_size (int) – batch size for training

Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.embedding_maps_movie(data, image, folder, beta, loss, filename='./embedding_maps', c_lim=None, mod=4, colorbar_shown=True)[source]¶
Parameters

  • data (numpy) – raw data to plot of embeddings

  • image (numpy) – the image of same size with the embeddings

  • folder (string) – the directory to save the result

  • beta (float) – beta value of the weights

  • loss (float) – loss of the weights

  • filename (string) – name of the file

  • c_lim (list of float) – the color range to show

  • mod (int) – number of plots for each row

  • colorbar_shown (boolean) – decide whether to show the colorbar

Returns

the plots

Return type

png

class Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.generator(model, scaled_data, image, channels=None, color_map='viridis')[source]¶

Bases: object

generator_images(folder, ranges=None, number_of_loops=200, averaging_number=100, graph_layout=[3, 3], model_type='dog', y_lim=[-2, 2], y_lim_1=[-2, 2], xlabel='Voltage (V)', ylabel='', xvalues=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • folder (string) – folder where to save

  • ranges (list) – range of each embedding value

  • number_of_loops (int) – embedding range divided by step size of it

  • averaging_number (int) – number of index which is nearest to the current value

  • graph_layout (list) – format of output graph

  • y_lim (list) – set the y scale

  • xlabel – set the label of x axis

:type xlabel; string :param ylabel: set the label of y axis :type ylabel: string :param xvalues: set the x axis :type xvalues: array

Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.get_activations(model, X=[], i=[], mode='test')[source]¶
function to get the activations of a specific layer

this function can take either a model and compute the activations or can load previously generated activations saved as an numpy array

Parameters

  • model (tensorflow keras model) – tensorflow keras model, object

  • X (numpy array) – input data

  • i (int) – index of the layer to extract

  • mode (string) – test or train, changes the model behavior to scale the network

Returns

array containing the output from layer i of the network

Return type

float

Autoencoders.Conv2d.beta_vae.training_images(model, data, image, number_layers, model_folder, beta, printing, folder, file_name)[source]¶

plots the training images

Parameters

  • model (tensorflow version model) – tensorflow object neural network model

  • data (numpy array) – data trained by the model

  • image (numpy array) – the image with the size of the plots

  • number_layers (int) – the index of the embedding layer

  • model_folder (string) – the directory of model weights

  • beta (string) – beta value of the weights

  • printing (dictionary) – printing format

  • folder (string) – directory to load the plots

  • file_name (string) – the name of the plots

DeepMatter.Autoencoders.Conv2d.nn module¶

Autoencoders.Conv2d.nn.AE_Train(model, train_iterator, optimizer, epochs, coef=0, coef_1=0, ln_parm=1, beta=None, path='./', filename='model')[source]¶
Args:

model: neural network to train train_iterator: data loader optimizer: optimizers epochs: number of epochs coef: initial regularization beta parameter coef_1: sets the rate of decay of the regularization parameter ln_parm: Set the order of the normalization beta: Set the beta value for B VAE path: path where data is saved filename: filename for file

Returns:

Autoencoders.Conv2d.nn.AE_extract_embeddings(model, data, **kwargs)[source]¶
Args:

model: autoencoder model data: data to extract embedding from **kwargs: batch_size - size of the batch to generate

Returns:

embeddings_: The embeddings of the model reconstruction_: The generated result from the model

Autoencoders.Conv2d.nn.AE_loss(model, train_iterator, optimizer, coef=0, coef1=0, ln_parm=1, beta=None)[source]¶

Function that calculates the loss of the autoencoder

Args:

model: model for the autoencoder train_iterator: pytorch data generator for autoencoder optimizer: optimizer that is used. coef: initial regularization beta parameter coef1: sets the rate of decay of the regularization parameter ln_parm: sets the learning rate beta: Beta value for VAE

Returns:

class Autoencoders.Conv2d.nn.DensePhysLarger(x_vector, model, dense_params=3, verbose=False, device='cuda', num_channels=1, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

forward(x, n=-1)[source]¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.
